options.name: -a
tip:
U: -a <FILENUM>
also print unpairable lines from file FILENUM, where FILENUM is 1 or 2, corresponding to FILE1 or FILE2
[possible values: 1, 2]

options.name: -v
tip:
U: -v <FILENUM>
like -a FILENUM, but suppress joined output lines
[possible values: 1, 2]

options.name: -e
tip: replace missing input fields with EMPTY

options.name: -i
options.tip: ignore differences in case when comparing fields

options.name: -o
tip: obey FORMAT while constructing output line

options.name: -t
tip: use CHAR as input and output field separator
join on this FIELD of file 1
join on this FIELD of file 2

options.name: --check-order
options.tip: check that the input is correctly sorted, even if all input lines are pairable

options.name: --nocheck-order
options.tip: do not check that the input is correctly sorted

options.name: --header
options.tip: treat the first line in each file as field headers, print them without trying to pair them

options.name: -z
options.tip: line delimiter is NUL, not newline

description:
For each pair of input lines with identical join fields, write a line to standard output.
The default join field is the first, delimited by blanks.
Come from [uutils/coreutils](https://github.com/uutils/coreutils)
